alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Greene (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:17PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster and central Greene Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 217 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Milton, or near Saugerties, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Windham, North-South Lake Campground, Cairo, Durso Corner, Asbury, East Durham, Quarryville, Manorville, Katsbaan, Greenville Center, Maplecrest, Round Top, Result, Haines Falls, Sanfords Corners, Kiskatom, Sunside, Blue Mountain, Cairo Junction and Place Corners. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Greene
